original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs40 billion bills post – auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT -Sri Lanka has sold 40 billion worth of treasury bills after the May 31,2023 auction in a phase 2 offer.
In the original auction the debt office sold all offered 160 billion rupees of Treasury bills.
The debt office accepted 59.9 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.65 percent, fell by one basis points from a week earlier, after offering 75 billion rupees.
31.9 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.29 percent, fell by one basis points from a week earlier after offering 35 billion rupees.
68.1 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.91 percent, fell by six basis points from a week earlier after offering 50 billion.
